pull.title: Make rpcauth help message clearer, add example in example .conf
pull.body: Some users are confused about the interplay of the three different ways of authenticating rpc requests. This is meant to give extra clarity.

events.message: Make rpcauth help message clearer, add example in example .conf

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -67,9 +67,30 @@
 # This option can be specified multiple times (default: bind to all interfaces)
 #rpcbind=<addr>
 
-# You must set rpcuser and rpcpassword to secure the JSON-RPC api
+# If no rpcpassword is set, rpc cookie auth is sought. The default `-rpccookiefile` name
comments.body: Note: cookie is only created if `-server=1`

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -67,9 +67,30 @@
 # This option can be specified multiple times (default: bind to all interfaces)
 #rpcbind=<addr>
 
-# You must set rpcuser and rpcpassword to secure the JSON-RPC api
+# If no rpcpassword is set, rpc cookie auth is sought. The default `-rpccookiefile` name
comments.body: Do you imagine any reason why it would be otherwise?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -67,9 +67,30 @@
 # This option can be specified multiple times (default: bind to all interfaces)
 #rpcbind=<addr>
 
-# You must set rpcuser and rpcpassword to secure the JSON-RPC api
+# If no rpcpassword is set, rpc cookie auth is sought. The default `-rpccookiefile` name
comments.body: No, but more than one user was apparently confused by this!(getting feedback offline) Maybe it's too obvious.
Could make sense to split the translation string into smaller logical chunks while touching?
